name: places/ChIJvXR46Pj1wokRVCBMrSisJvY
formattedAddress: 64 Sunken Garden Loop, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: 64 Sunken Garden Loop, New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text:
The Keener Building, while still better than the Schwartz Assessment Center behind it, is a clean facility with employees who see the men living there as an inconvenience instead of a populace that they're to serve.

My first night here I was told by staff that I would be assigned a bed at 10pm. The staff had yet to give myself and five other weary men a place to lie our heads until well after 2am. And even after that gaff, the original occupant of the bed given to me returned at 8pm that same day. So here I am displaced yet another night while the staff refuses to safeguard my belongings or even offer the solace of pretending to care about how tired I am.

It's despicable that they will treat us this way yet label us as clients. Where is the dignity and respect??

originalText.text: Any individual  believing NYC can be an affordable dream, HELP USA got me there.

text.text: Any individual  believing NYC can be an affordable dream, HELP USA got me there.

originalText.text: After a few days in the system, they'll walk you over² this place to do a whole medical check-up on you. The medical staff is very polite and positive. Also if you've recently been to your doctor ⁴a check-up prior ²this, then you can just show the results from that check-up to them from your mychart app and you're good.

originalText.text: First & foremost, the maintenance director, the social service director, and the operations director, here at Keener are the terrible three, and should no longer hold those prestigeous positions and getting paid lovely while clients like myself have to reside in these deplorable downright depressing conditions. There is never adequate heat or hot water for showers. The hot water should run just as good as the cold water, however, you are very lucky when you can get a hot shower.  Hopefully, you don't have a job interview or need to get somewhere very important and need to look your best because you will be very disappointed. Furthermore, the maintenance director takes it personally when we connect with 311 and make complaints like he owns the place. However DHS controls heat and hot water not the maintenance staff, so what is the real problem here? Consequently, these three people run this place together like it is a New York State prison instead of a place a man come and get some help.

originalText.text: Words won't describe how bad this place or the staff is, so I'll just upload a compilation video of all the issues here, absolutely horrid staff members been here for 3 months look the other way or choose a different shelter if you can, they steal ya stuff, they restrict you from doing laundry  on the days you are scheduled for it, the staff is disrespectful, many times I've been delayed from the things I need to do just by being here, . Look out for another comment with a YouTube link to my experience here so far. Horribleeeeeee
